item.description:
10/11 Columbus Day

There are not too many tickets left for the TAPs show.
I hate buying tickets for 1 Yes & any maybes but I took
The chance anyways.

If anyone is still a maybe by the 17th,
Then you really should know if you are going or not,
I will be taking away Maybe as an option by then.

I bought 3 tickets for the rear balcony.
They will be in Row G near each other.
I better bring binoculars.

There is a Harvest Festival in Torrington, so there
Will be no parking on Main Street.
It might take a while to find parking & to walk to the
Theatre.

--------------------------------------------------------------------
Ghost Hunters Live will be on Oct. 22 starting at 8 p.m

at the Warner Theatre in Torrington.

Check the website for more information such as how much it will cost.

You are responsible for your own payment.

If there are reservations required (see the website),
Then you are responsible for your own reservation.

http://www.warnerthea...

www.warnertheatre.org/index.htm

Also

http://www.the-atlant...

www.the-atlantic-paranormal-society.com/

I will send a reminder before the event.

I have not been there before, so I really do not know the
Best place to meet if anyone else does come.

Remember - TAPS Magazine can be bought at
Barnes & Noble and in some Borders.

..........................................................................

The Warner Theater, Torrington

A ghost named Murph is said to haunt the Warner Theater.
Rumor has it that Murph was a homeless man seeking shelter
in the theater, and once inside, fell down the stairs.
Cold air on hot days, lights mysteriously flickering off and
strange activity in the balcony have been reported.

#11


http://www.ctnow.com/...

www.ctnow.com/entertainment/holiday/halloween/hc-hauntedct-pg,0,6001081.photogallery
item.how_to_find_us: I will e-mail those who RSVP Yes or Maybe before the event.

group.name: Greater New Haven Unknown Zone Meetup Group

item.name: UZ investigates TAPS in Torrington on Oct. 22
